intro: Ozothamnus eriocephalus, commonly known as the woolly goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Ozothamnus eriocephalus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
